visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing comparison of corn vs wheat estimated production across 10 agricultural regions using synthetic data with regional production trends and category-specific color encoding

accessibility.description: Comparison of annual grain production across major agricultural regions. Corn dominates in North America while wheat production shows strong concentration in EU-27 and Black Sea regions.

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative variables (corn and wheat production) across 10 categorical regions. Synthetic data was generated using USDA historical averages (μ_corn=82.5 MMT, σ=118.6; μ_wheat=49.9 MMT, σ=48.2) with intentional clustering patterns reflecting real-world production geography. Regional totals maintain proportional relationships observed in FAO agricultural reports. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio through direct categorical comparison, eliminating gridlines while maintaining clear value markers. Color choices follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles using high-contrast hues (blue/orange) for immediate series differentiation. Wheat production data exhibits bimodal distribution (EU/Black Sea clusters), while corn shows right-skewed distribution with North American outlier. Value formatting uses D3-style comma separation for large numbers, improving numerical parsing efficiency.
